summary: This document contains various financial records related to the estate of Jeffrey Epstein, including account information, transactions, and correspondence regarding the liquidation of entity accounts. It highlights the management of Epstein's estate and the closure of accounts associated with his businesses. This document contains various bank records related to Jeffrey Epstein and his company, Jeepers, Inc. It includes account maintenance forms, corporate resolutions, and due diligence checklists. The records detail the banking relationship Epstein had with FirstBank, including account management, beneficial ownership, and compliance with banking regulations. This document outlines the Articles of Incorporation for a corporation formed in the Virgin Islands. It details the powers, purposes, and management structure of the corporation, including the issuance of stock and the responsibilities of the board of directors. The document is significant as it establishes the legal framework for the corporation's operations. This document appears to be a series of agreements and terms related to the use of e-FirstBank services, including account management and indemnification clauses. It outlines the responsibilities of the depositor and the bank, as well as the terms for accessing online banking services. The document emphasizes the importance of maintaining security and compliance with the bank's policies.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's estate is in the process of liquidating various entity accounts.
Darren Indyke and Michelle Smith-Roberts are actively managing the estate's financial matters.
Multiple attorneys are involved in the legal aspects of the estate's liquidation.
The document includes financial records of transactions related to Epstein's estate.
There are references to specific entities associated with Epstein, such as Jeepers, Inc. and Thomas World Air, LLC.
Jeffrey Epstein is the primary account holder for Jeepers, Inc. at FirstBank.
Darren Indyke is listed as an authorized signer for Epstein's accounts.
Richard Young is the market manager overseeing Epstein's banking relationship.
Jeepers, Inc. was incorporated on August 18, 2003, in the Virgin Islands.
The corporation was certified to be in good standing on May 15, 2007.
The corporation is authorized to issue 1,000 shares of common stock with no par value.
The minimum capital required to commence business is $1,000.
The document was signed and acknowledged on August 1, 2003, by the incorporators.
The corporation is designed to have perpetual existence and unlimited indebtedness.
The incorporators are Barbara Mignon Weatherly, Ena Simon, and Mary R. Weber, all residing in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands.
The document includes indemnification clauses for directors and officers of the corporation.
It outlines the terms and conditions for using e-FirstBank services.
The depositor agrees to comply with all agreements related to their accounts.
The document emphasizes the importance of maintaining security for online banking access.
There are provisions for modifying the terms of the agreement by the bank.
